title: 107_s2449
content: The Act titled "Federal Responsibility for Immigrant Health Act of 2002" allows federal payments under Medicaid for emergency medical conditions of certain aliens. The Social Security Act is amended to include necessary care and services for emergency medical conditions of aliens, pregnancy-related services, and conditions that may complicate pregnancy. The Social Security Act is amended to include services for emergency medical conditions of aliens, pregnancy-related services, and communicable diseases testing or treatment. State options are provided to eliminate residency requirements for certain aliens. The amendments made by this section regarding payment for medical assistance shall apply to services provided after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens. Funding for emergency health services for undocumented aliens is amended to provide $25,000,000 for fiscal years 1998 through 2001 and $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. State allotments determination is also amended to include specific guidelines. The Secretary will compute an allotment for each of the 15 States with the highest percentage of undocumented aliens for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The allotment for each State will be based on the total amount available. The allotment to a State is based on the percentage of undocumented aliens in the State compared to all States. Any unspent allotment is carried over to the next fiscal year. The percentage of undocumented aliens in a State is determined based on the most recent estimates prepared by the Statistics Division of the Immigration and Naturalization Service. Funds must be used to assist hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens. The Secretary shall pay allotted amounts to States for hospitals and providers of emergency health services to undocumented aliens in areas impacted by health costs related to undocumented aliens. The Secretary will pay States for emergency medical services provided to undocumented aliens by eligible hospitals and related providers, based on their payments under the State plan approved under title XIX of the Social Security Act or an alternative proxy for measuring the volume of services. The term 'hospital' is defined as per section 1861(e) of the Social Security Act. The term 'provider' includes physicians, healthcare professionals, and entities providing emergency ambulance services. Providers related to hospitals are those furnishing emergency health services to individuals. The hospital provides emergency health services to individuals, and payments under this subsection cannot replace federal payments to states for emergency medical services or be used by states for other purposes. The amendments made by this section shall apply beginning with fiscal year 2003. Permitting states and localities to provide health care to all individuals. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to remove certain paragraphs in subsections (b) and (c), including changes related to health care provisions. The Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act of 1996 is amended to exclude health benefits provided by state or local government agencies or funds. The amendments apply to health care provided before, on, or after the enactment of the Act.
